contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom God has called to be holy people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τῇ ... οὔσῃ ... κλητοῖς ἁγίοις ... τοῖς ἐπικαλουμένοις
contextId.glQuote: who are called to be holy people

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul speaks of "words of human wisdom" as if they were people, the cross as a container, and of power as a physical thing that Jesus can put in that container. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "words of human wisdom ... those words of human wisdom should not empty the cross of Christ of its power" or "words of human wisdom ... people should not stop believing the message about Jesus and start thinking I am more important than Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: words of human wisdom ... the cross of Christ should not be emptied of its power

contextId.occurrenceNote: "about Christ, who died on a cross" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Christ crucified

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that which people usually regard as without value" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: things that are regarded as nothing

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "things that people think are worth money" or "things that people think are worth respect" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: things that are held as valuable

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that God freely gave to us" or "that God has kindly given us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: freely given to us by God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "According to the task that God freely gave me to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: κατὰ τὴν χάριν τοῦ Θεοῦ τὴν δοθεῖσάν μοι
contextId.glQuote: According to the grace of God that was given to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated as active. Alternate translation: "no one can lay a foundation other than the foundation that I, Paul, have laid" or "I have already laid the only foundation that anyone can lay" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: no one can lay a foundation other than the one that has been laid

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will show everyone what the builder has done" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his work will be revealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if the fire destroys anyone's work" or "if the fire ruins anyone's work" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if anyone's work is burned up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but God will save him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but he himself will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to hitting with the hand, not with whips or clubs. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people beat us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we are brutally beaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When people revile us, we bless them" or "When people scorn us, we bless them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When we are reviled, we bless

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When people persecute us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When we are persecuted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When people slander us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When we are slandered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that not even the Gentiles permit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that is not even permitted among the Gentiles

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must remove the one who did this from among you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀρθῇ ἐκ μέσου ὑμῶν ὁ ... τοῦτο ποιήσας
contextId.glQuote: The one who did this must be removed from among you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that God may save his spirit on the day of the Lord" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἵνα τὸ πνεῦμα σωθῇ ἐν τῇ ἡμέρᾳ τοῦ Κυρίου
contextId.glQuote: so that his spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a believer submits that case" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that case is placed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has cleansed you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you have been cleansed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has set you apart for himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you have been sanctified

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has made you right with him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you have been made right with God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will not allow these things to rule over me like a master" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will not be mastered by any of them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can also be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when a man joins his body to the body of a prostitute, it is as if their bodies become one body" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he who is joined to a prostitute becomes one flesh with her

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can also be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when the Lord joins his spirit to the spirit of a person, it is as if their spirits become one spirit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he who is joined to the Lord becomes one spirit with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: God paid for the freedom of the Corinthians from the slavery of sin. This can be stated as active. Alternate translation: "God paid for your freedom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For you were bought with a price

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "she should make peace with her husband and return to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be reconciled to her husband

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "For God has set apart the unbelieving husband for himself because of his believing wife" or 2) "God treats the unbelieving husband as he would treat a son for the sake of his believing wife" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For the unbelieving husband is set apart because of his wife

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "God has set apart the unbelieving wife for himself because of her husband who believes" or 2) "God treats the unbelieving wife as he would treat a daughter for the sake of her husband who believes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the unbelieving wife is set apart because of the brother

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "God has set them apart for himself" or 2) "God treats them as he would treat his own children" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are set apart

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Christ bought you by dying for you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You have been bought with a price

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when God called us to believe in him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when we were called to believe

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God knows that person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that person is known by him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so you will do something for me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so something might be done for me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I must do this work that God trusted me to complete" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I still have a responsibility that was entrusted to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This passive sentence can be rephrased to an active form. The judge of a race or competition is a metaphor for God. Alternate translation: "the judge will not disqualify me" or "God will not say that I have failed to obey the rules" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: I myself may not be disqualified

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "did. As a result, snakes destroyed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: did and were destroyed by snakes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "did. As a result, an angel of death destroyed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: did and were destroyed by an angel of death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will not allow anyone to tempt you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will not let you be tempted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: Possible meanings are 1) "must not cover his head" or 2) "does not need to cover his head" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: should not have his head covered

contextId.occurrenceNote: God made the woman by taking a bone from the man and making the woman from that bone. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God did not make the man from the woman. Instead, he made the woman from the man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For man was not made from woman. Instead, woman was made from man

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul expects the Corinthians to agree with him. This can be stated in active form. "To honor God, a woman should pray to God with a covering on her head." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.glQuote: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For God created woman with hair" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For her hair has been given to her

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "on the night that Judas Iscariot betrayed him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: on the night when he was betrayed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will not judge us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we will not be judged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Lord judges us, he disciplines us, so that he will not condemn us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: κρινόμενοι ... ὑπὸ Κυρίου, παιδευόμεθα, ἵνα μὴ ... κατακριθῶμεν
contextId.glQuote: we are judged by the Lord, we are disciplined, so that we may not be condemned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. God is the one who does the giving ([1 Corinthians 12:6](../12/06.md)). Alternate translation: "God gives to each one" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to each one is given

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "by means of the Spirit God gives to one person the word" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to one is given by the Spirit the word

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how this is translated in [1 Corinthians 12:8](../12/08.md). Alternate translation: "God gives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is given

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) the Holy Spirit is the one who baptizes us, "For one Spirit baptized us" or 2) that the Spirit, like the water of baptism, is the medium through which we are baptized into the body, "For in one Spirit we were all baptized" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.quote: γὰρ ἐν ἑνὶ Πνεύματι ἡμεῖς πάντες ... ἐβαπτίσθημεν
contextId.glQuote: For by one Spirit we were all baptized

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God gave all of us the same Spirit, and we share the Spirit as people might share a drink" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: all were made to drink of one Spirit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone gives honor to one member" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: one member is honored

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "to be burned" can be made active. Alternate translation: "I allow those who persecute me to burn me to death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I give my body to be burned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one will be able to make it angry quickly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is not easily angered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated as active. Alternate translation: "just as Christ has known me fully" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: just as I have been fully known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form: Alternate translation: "The prophet wrote these words in the law:" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: In the law it is written,

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "interpret what they said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: interpret what is said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to what they say" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to what is said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if God gives someone insight" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: if an insight is given to one

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you may encourage all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all may be encouraged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you should not recognize him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let him not be recognized

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "God will save you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you are being saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they buried him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God raised him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has not even raised Christ" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: not even Christ has been raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "everyone will realize that we are" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we are found to be

contextId.occurrenceNote: "Raised" here is an idiom for "caused to live again." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has raised Christ, who is the firstfruits of those who died" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Christ, who is the firstfruits of those who died, has been raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul speaks of death here as if it were a person whom God will kill. Alternate translation: "The final enemy that God will destroy is death itself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-personification]])
contextId.glQuote: The last enemy to be destroyed is death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can stated as active. Alternate translation: "God has made all things subject to Christ" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all things are subjected to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can stated as active. Alternate translation: "the Son himself will become subject" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the Son himself will be subjected

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God does not raise the dead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the dead are not raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: God made the first man, Adam, from the dust of the earth. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The first man is of the earth, made of dust

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated as active. Alternate translation: "God will change us all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we will all be changed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will change us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We will be changed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will raise the dead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the dead will be raised
